participants: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire

messages.message: Heads up, our friends at FRB reported a possible vulnerability: https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/INFRA-829 /cc @georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire @will

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: They found this in an older version - can we just confirm if this is still a vulnerability for now? and if so, then we can work on remediating?
yeah, I'm unclear which version Logan is using
That doesn’t sound like a vulnerability. He is concerned that from instabase he can get credentials for instabase?

@georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire I don’t think this is easy to remediate, or whether we should remediate this at all.  We should just tell them that these are all configuration parameters while we set up instabase at FRB.
although, from what that person is trying to do, they can do significantly more damage :slightly_smiling_face:
Also, how did they find the `.app_config` field in there.  I don’t think we expose it
